name: Two Pointers
description: Use a left and right pointer moving toward each other to find pairs efficiently.

overview.what: Two pointers scan from opposite ends (or same direction) to exploit ordering or constraints.
overview.when: Use on sorted arrays/strings when searching for pairs/windows with a target relation.

steps.reason: Left starts at index 0, right at the end.
Add values at both pointers to compare with target.
If sum equals target, return the indices.
If sum is too small, move left pointer right to increase.
If sum is too large, move right pointer left to decrease.
If pointers cross, no valid pair exists.
